website_summaries.verdict: A fantastic solution for customers needing a medium-sized dressing stick with a soft foam handle.
pros: Foam padding allows for a comfortable grip when extra strength is needed to pull on clothes
Features a push-and-pull hook and a "c" hook for smaller clothing adjustments
cons: A few customers were not impressed by the large push-and-pull hook, but found the "c" curve useful

customer_reviews.title: Independence With Safety For Senior.
customer_reviews.text: This Economy Reacher was a Valentine's gift for my grandmother. Who has always been Pettitte. When she was younger she thought nothing of climbing up on something to get a drape or.curtain open. However, we as family have begun to worry. We were having trouble finding.the right item for her . When I happened to mentioned our dilemma to my boyfriend as we were talking. He mentioned this item and it looked like it would work. It is taking her some time to remember to use the teacher and not climb but, other then that it is working well at keeping grandma independent and safe. Would highly recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Her Royal Peepness Princess HoneyBunny BlayzeTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had surgery on both of my shoulders. Due to limited shoulder movement, this dressing stick has been very useful in helping me take off my socks, since it is very difficult for me to reach down to remove them otherwise. Also, I found the dressing stick works pretty well to place medicine bottles in my cabinet. The bottle cap top fits just right into the curved "U" part of the coated wire end. I even used the hooked end to place a loose hook from my shower curtain back up on the shower curtain bar. So, you see that this product has many uses. Would definitely purchase this item again!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah B

customer_reviews.title: Great tool in places where grabber won't work.
customer_reviews.text: I'm short and recently became disabled. I have purchased many items like grabbers to help me out, but there are many things they can't do that this can! Hang clothes, close curtains, upper lock on door, getting socks off, open cupboards, pull blankets back on bed and many other things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Frequent Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this assistive dressing device. Helps me pull up my pants, take off my socks, and is solid for the price. If you have back surgery or an injury that prevents you from bending, get this.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus and Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Sammons Preston 26" Deluxe Dressing Stick and Sock Puller, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I had to use my old bent one until I had the money for a different one because this one the metal or wire inside the plastic lining broke. My old one was being used steadily since 2001. I should have gotten longer use out of it than that. I don't recommend this one to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Atchison

customer_reviews.title: only helped with socks
customer_reviews.text: There are no directions available on how to use it -- even from the manufacturer. It does help in pulling on socks, but is said to do much more. The seller was great and helped all they could, but the product wasn't as useful as implied.
customer_reviews.author: N. M.

customer_reviews.title: really helpful in getting dressed or undressed
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing to dislike.I'm sorry I waited this long before ordering one
customer_reviews.author: harryo

customer_reviews.title: Useful and solid.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to raise and lower window blinds that were awkward to get to since the windows are blocked by furniture. This did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Philiboy

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Book Faulty
customer_reviews.text: The zipper hook was too big to fit any of my zippers. They did say I could return it but the shipping cost more than the item. Just wasted my money on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Stivers

customer_reviews.title: Handy Dandy
customer_reviews.text: These "sticks" have a multitude of uses, not to mention their main purpose of putting on your slacks. I keep one in bath, bedroom and laundry room.
customer_reviews.author: Listener

customer_reviews.title: Easier Life
customer_reviews.text: Well made. sturdy. and truly an aid to help me get dressed. I have osteoarthritis and will soon be getting a new hip. It makes getting dressed less stressful and much it goes much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: great stick
customer_reviews.text: I must admit, I use this stick to open and close my bedroom window while in bed, and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality item.
customer_reviews.text: Love this dressing stick. Had hip replacement and then dislocated it. Had thrown my original stick out. So, glad to be able to fund this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rosey G

customer_reviews.title: so many movements we take for granted are very painful. You will know when you did one
customer_reviews.text: How did I do without. I am due a hip replacement, so many movements we take for granted are very painful. You will know when you did one. You are only limited by your imagination.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The person this was purchased for is getting very good use from it!
customer_reviews.author: Tresjola Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Economy Dressing Stick
customer_reviews.text: The dressing stick been helpful even though I haven't had to use it much yet. I can see it's value for anyone wanting to stay independent. A very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael James

customer_reviews.title: Prevents you from bending over
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. It have saved me from bending my knees, which I have arthritis in. I have purchased another for my mom who have back broblems. I recommend it, if you have problems bending over.
customer_reviews.author: thick madame

customer_reviews.title: ... still have not figured out how to make it useful to help me
customer_reviews.text: I still have not figured out how to make it useful to help me. Also, I only order one and not two unless I accidently entered a "2" un-be known to me.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: You could easily make one yourself. Or just buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Gave to elderly mother who finds more uses for it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Helps every day love this thing after two major back surgeries
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: OK and stronger than most but would have been better with an L hook.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying it just to help me pull my zippers up but it has turned out to be a great aid in lots of other ways.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon E. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Dressing Stick
customer_reviews.text: This has definitely helped my mother get dressed after her recent back surgery, since she cannot bend or twist for at least three months. She raves about it! It was a great price, too!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good deal good product
customer_reviews.text: A inexpensive item I needed after hip replacement surgery and the hip kit I bought did not have a dressing stick included. Worked out great
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE THINGS!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE THINGS!! I am 5'2 and my 6ft husband is NOT always around to get high things for me! I had one in my closet to grab things on shelves .. bought one each for the laundry area for a high shelf .. one for the kitchen .. NOW I am going to order for my petite daughter! These things are perfect for grabbing things from high shelves!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hooks are too fragile to withstand heavy pressures; they bend and eventually will break from use.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S. Neary

customer_reviews.title: Dressing Stick
customer_reviews.text: the price was right and it looks & works good ... for dressing... Need assistance with pants, underwear, socks, etc.
customer_reviews.author: PIERA BIANCALANA

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it but lengthened the dowel to 3 ft. to make it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Klapatch

customer_reviews.title: Not as discribed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and it came but it shows that it has plastic over the metal and the C did not it was sharp and I just got out of surgery and not good to be able to use without scratching my skin. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: DVD Collector

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting socks off!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for a very specific reason, so that my husband could remove his socks. We have a grabber with a screw on the end, but my husband's swollen feet needed more oomph than it offered. This works seamlessly for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Customer
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased this product. My husband needs help dressing and wants to feel more independent so I bought this second stick so he could use it wherever he needed to change clothes. We loved not having to pay as much for the new one. We recommend this company for their fast service, excellent prices, and great products.
customer_reviews.author: Jack's Widow 19

customer_reviews.title: Many Uses
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my son's use after he had hip replacement as bending and moving was a challenge. This was a great help in being able to dress himself easier. He was shown how to use this aid in the nursing facility during his recovery by the physical therapist. He has since found multiple uses for this item.
customer_reviews.author: L S

customer_reviews.title: I orders these all the time for patients as I ...
customer_reviews.text: I orders these all the time for patients as I am a home health occupational therapist. This arrived in a timely manner and works well. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: 44Tay44

customer_reviews.title: Handy stick
customer_reviews.text: This stick is sturdy and helps when pulling up pants, pushing off shoes or buttoning up a shirt. I would recommend this stick to every person that need help with putting on a item of clothing. My great aunt really like the easy use of it.
customer_reviews.author: C. B.

customer_reviews.title: you could learn to use it better than I
customer_reviews.text: wasn't able to learn how to use it. maybe if you can't bend over for a long extended time , you could learn to use it better than I .
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Gold Star Tool
customer_reviews.text: You must buy one of these things even if you aren't handicapped. I am newly handicapped and I use it constantly. I wonder how I never knew about it. Life would have been easier
customer_reviews.author: C.Farnham

customer_reviews.title: ... too long for me and it would be more useful to me if it hand a larger grip since ...
customer_reviews.text: a little too long for me and it would be more useful to me if it hand a larger grip since I have issues with my hand
customer_reviews.author: LYN

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get the hang of it. My occupational therapist showed me much simpler ways to get dressed without a stick.
customer_reviews.author: lydia g. klimczuk

customer_reviews.title: Handy for a lot of things.
customer_reviews.text: This gets used for a lot of things other than dressing. It is just handy for a lot lf things. The only thing I have noticed is the wood rod is not very strong and would not last if used for anything heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Great aid for dressing and picking up clothes or shoes. Bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad. He was having trouble getting his shoes on. This worked fantastic. He found all sorts of uses for it in addition.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: wonderful medical tool
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to someone after a hip replacement. This is a great aid in getting dressing without needing assistance and well worth the $10 price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: It came in very handy for my husband after his ...
customer_reviews.text: It came in very handy for my husband after his illness. He was able to use it to assist with getting dressed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by occupational therapist after heart surgery. Really helps father-in-law with dressing.
customer_reviews.author: MommaD

customer_reviews.title: awesome. never leave home without it
customer_reviews.text: totally useful for my handicap.. cant get my hands to my feet so this helps with getting my socks off.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to take socks off.
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool to take my socks off; because of my back pain that task was a hassle, buy now this tool made this task a very easy one.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: very helpful
customer_reviews.text: i was not sure this would help me at all but it helps out alot. even works great as a back scratchier.
customer_reviews.author: wncbill

customer_reviews.title: So-So
customer_reviews.text: Works OK but I don't know how long it will last. Stick is very thin.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Fowler Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort of wood and smooth edges
customer_reviews.text: I use it to open and close drapes! Very handy and doesn't snag on fabric.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: my husband used this and it works perfectly for his needs
customer_reviews.author: babsey

customer_reviews.title: Has many uses.
customer_reviews.text: This dressing stick is great tool for those individuals that have difficulty bending. It has many uses. I use them to put on slacks, and taking off shoes and socks. For the longest time I would not go to clothing stores because trying on clothes was difficult. So now when needed, I take the dressing stick with me. It has come in handy when I drop things on the floor. The hook can be used to pick up keys or garments that drop. This has greatly helped me be more independent. It well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Wondering about durability
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be fine. Just have to see how well it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Aid
customer_reviews.text: Great Aid in helping one dress especially for a person who has mobility problems. I don't know what I would do without it.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

product_meta.title: Sammons Preston 26" Deluxe Dressing Stick and Sock Puller with Button Hook, Belt & Stocking Donner, Disability Aid for Daily Independent Living, Lightweight Economy Assistant Tool for Getting Dressed
product_meta.description:
Style:Deluxe Grip HandleFor over 50 years, Sammons Preston has been the premier brand in aids to daily living and homecare devices. Sammons Preston products are adaptive living aids that help people cope with their environment. Whether you are a therapist or patient, someone with special needs, or just have a need to make life easier and more accessible, Sammons Preston products can help you. Occupational therapists, physical therapists, nurses, and other healthcare professionals rely on Sammons Preston adaptive utensils, adaptive plates and silverware, nosey cups, reachers and grabbers, grab bars, sock pullers, shoe horns, dressing sticks, hip kits, leg lifters, back scrubbers, gait belts, wheelchair belts, trays, and wheelchair accessories. These are the same high quality professional products used in hospitals, clinics, and nursing homes.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Not Applicable
feature_bullets: Perfect all-around dressing solution features small C-hook at one end and large, plastic coated push/pull hook on the other to assist with donning shirts, pants, jackets, and slacks, and helps removes socks and stockings
Versatile hook/pusher combination allows for multi-functional uses as an independent daily living aid, such as acting as a sock puller and dress hooks
Lightweight 5 oz stick with 26 inch reach provides ample length to reach from short distances, ergonomic design makes it more efficient to put on and take off one's own clothes
Lightweight, high quality wooden shaft allows users with limited reach and range of motion to independently dress without the assistance of others
Deluxe model has built-up foam grip on shaft, plastic coated to maintain durability and assist user even when used with rough fabrics requiring greater force
